text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to explain that New York state courts enjoin international arbitration in limited circumstances, specifically when the arbitration agreement is null and void, inoperative, or incapable of being performed. The candidate answer focuses entirely on defending the *enforcement* of an award already rendered under Article V of the New York Convention against challenges based on jurisdiction and due process. It does not address the circumstances under which a New York court would *enjoin* (stop) the arbitration proceedings *before* an award is rendered, which is what the criterion specifically asks about (i.e., the grounds for granting an injunction against arbitration).", "criterion_id": "f24c358a-43a3-47ef-b32c-ce86625942a9"}
